# Favorite plot

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| label: favorite-plot

library(ggplot2) # load ggplot2 package

# Read data
games <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-03-16/games.csv', show_col_types = FALSE) 

# Filter the default games
default_games <- c("Counter-Strike: Global Offensive", "Stardew Valley", "Tabletop Simulator", "Team Fortress 2")

# Create a subset only contains default games
result <- subset(games, games$gamename %in% default_games)

# Change month to numeric
result$month_num <- match(result$month, month.name)
result$date <- result$year + (result$month_num -1)/12

# Draw the plot
ggplot(data = result, 
       aes(x = date, y = avg, group = gamename, color = gamename)) + 
  geom_line()+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2016,2021,1), limits = c(2016,2021))
```
